text.0: help varuṇa and mitra o ye twain allied with vasus rudras and Ādityas help our car.
text.1: that as the wild birds of the forest from their home our horses may fly forth glad eager for renown.
text.2: yea now ye gods of one accord speed on our car what time among the folk it seeks an act of might.
text.3: when hasting through the region with the stamp of hoofs our swift steeds trample on the ridges of the earth.
text.4: or may our indra here the friend of all mankind coming from heaven most wise girt by the marut host.
text.5: accompany with aid untroubled by a foe our car to mighty gain to win the meed of strength.
text.6: or may this tvaṣṭar god who rules the world with power oneminded with the goddesses speed forth our car.
text.7: iḷā and bhaga the celestial earth and heaven pūṣan purandhi and the aśvins ruling lords.
text.8: or seen alternate those two blessed goddesses morning and night who stir all living things to act.
text.9: while with my newest song i praise you both o earth that from what moves not ye may spread forth threefold food.
text.10: your blessing as a boon for suppliants we desire the dragon of the deep and ajaekapād.
text.11: trita Ṛbhukṣan savitar shall joy in us and the floods swift child in our worship and our prayer.
text.12: these earnest prayers i pray to you ye holy to pay you honour living men have formed them.
text.13: men fain to win the prize and glory may they win as a carhorse might the goal your notice.
